items.title: Intersection
items.description: The crash occurred within the intersection proper or within the crosswalk area. Note: Driveways controlled by signals or signs should be coded as Intersections. Uncontrolled driveways should be coded as Non-Intersection Locations.

items.title: Intersection-Related
items.description: The crash occurred outside the intersection crosswalk area but within 15 m (50 ft) of the intersection.

items.title: Non-Intersection Location
items.description: The crash occured on or along the roadway and more than 15 m (50 ft) away from an intersection.

items.title: Non-Roadway Location
items.description: The crash occurred off the roadway, including parking lots, driveways, private roads, yards, alleys, and other open areas. Note: Crashes occurring on paved shoulders, sidewalks, or driveway crossings are considered to be "roadway" crashes and should not be placed in the Non-Roadway classification.

items.title: Unknown/Insufficient Information
items.description: There is insufficient information to determine where the crash occurred.

2.title: Unusual Circumstances
2.description: The crash was the result of which of the following unusual circumstances:

items.title: Assault with Vehicle
items.description: The driver intentionally struck the pedestrian with the vehicle.

items.title: Dispute-Related
items.description: The pedestrian was struck by a vehicle during a domestic altercation or other dispute.

items.title: Pedestrian on Vehicle
items.description: The pedestrian was sitting on, leaning against, or clinging to a vehicle which began to move or was moving.

items.title: Vehicle-Vehicle/Object
items.description: The pedestrian was struck as a result of a prior vehicle-into-vehicle or vehicle-into-object crash.

items.title: Motor Vehicle Loss of Control
items.description: Vehicle lost control due to mechanical failure, surface conditions, driver error or impairment.

items.title: Pedestrian Loss of Control
items.description: The pedestrian stumbled, fell, or rolled into path of vehicle due to surface conditions, impairment or other mishap.

items.title: Other Unusual Circumstances
items.description: The crash involved other unusual circumstances, such as a pedestrian being struck by falling cargo or a loose wheel.

items.title: None of the Above
items.description: The crash did not involve any of the unusual circumstances described.

1A.title: Pedestrian Position - Intersection Or Intersection-Related
1A.description: What was the position of the pedestrian when struck?

items.title: Within a crosswalk, marked or unmarked
On a roadway, in a travel lane
On a roadway, in a paved shoulder, bike lane, or parking lane
On a sidewalk, shared use path, or driveway crossing

1B.title: Pedestrian Position - Non-Intersection
1B.description: What was the position of the pedestrian when struck?

items.title: Within a crosswalk, marked or unmarked
On a roadway, in a travel lane
On a roadway, in a paved shoulder, bike lane, or parking lane
On a sidewalk, multi-use path, or driveway crossing

1C.title: Pedestrian Position - Non-Roadway
1C.description: What was the position of the pedestrian when struck?

items.title: Other non-roadway areas  ( parking lot, non-right-of-way sidewalk or multi-use path, yard, open areas, etc.)

3.title: Unusual Vehicle Type or Action
3.description: The crash involved which of the following vehicle types or vehicle actions:

items.title: Backing Vehicle
items.description: The pedestrian was struck by a vehicle that was backing with a driver at the controls.

items.title: Driverless Vehicle
items.description: The pedestrian was struck by a vehicle that was moving without a driver at the controls, or that was set in motion by the actions of a child.

items.title: Disabled Vehicle-Related
items.description: The pedestrian was struck while near or next to a disabled vehicle (including a vehicle that had been in a crash) or while walking to or from a disabled vehicle. Note: Crashes involving pedestrians standing near tow trucks responding to the disabled vehicle are also included in this crash type.

items.title: Emergency Vehicle-Related
items.description: The pedestrian was struck while near an active emergency vehicle, by an active emergency vehicle, or by a vehicle being pursued.

items.title: Play Vehicle
items.description: The pedestrian was struck while riding a play vehicle that was not a bicycle (e.g., skates, scooter, wagon, sled, etc.)

items.title: None of the Above
items.description: The crash did not involve any of the unusual vehicle types or vehicle actions described.

3A.title: Backing Vehicle
3A.description: Where did the backing vehicle strike the pedestrian?

items.title: At the intersection of a driveway and sidewalk/walkway

3B.title: Backing Vehicle - Non-Roadway
3B.description: Where did the backing vehicle strike the pedestrian?

4.title: Unusual Pedestrian Action
4.description: The pedestrian was struck while performing which of the following actions:

items.title: Playing, Working, or Lying in Roadway
items.description: Playing, working, or lying in the roadway.

items.title: Entering/Exiting Parked Vehicle
items.description: The pedestrian was in the process of getting into or out of a stopped or parked vehicle. Note: Does not include crashes involving pedestrian crossing or other movements that occurred after the pedestrian exited the vehicle.

items.title: Mailbox-Related
items.description: Going to or from or standing at a mailbox or newspaper box.

items.title: Commercial Bus-Related
items.description: Crossing in front of a commercial bus stopped at a marked bus stop.

items.title: School Bus-Related
items.description: Going to or from or waiting at a school bus or school bus stop.

items.title: Ice-Cream/Vendor Truck-Related
items.description: Going to or from an ice-cream truck or other type of vehicle vending from the curb or roadside.

items.title: None of the Above
items.description: The pedestrian was not performing any of the unusual actions described.

4A.title: Working/Playing/Lying in Roadway
4A.description: Which of the following was the pedestrian doing when struck?

items.title: Working in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was working in the roadway when struck.

items.title: Playing in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was playing in the roadway when struck.

items.title: Lying in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was lying in the roadway when struck.

5.title: Non-Roadway Crash
5.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Parking Lot
items.description: The motor vehicle struck a pedestrian in a parking lot.

items.title: Other Circumstances
items.description: There were other or unknown circumstances surrounding the crash.

6.title: Typical Pedestrian Action - Intersection
6.description: Which of the following best describes the pedestrian action at the time of the crash?

items.title: Waiting to Cross
items.description: The pedestrian was standing near the curb or roadway edge and waiting to cross the roadway.

items.title: Crossing the Roadway or In the Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was crossing the roadway or in the roadway.

items.title: Walking Along Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was walking along the roadway on the edge of a travel lane, on a paved or unpaved shoulder, grassy right-of-way or sidewalk.

items.title: Crossing a Driveway
items.description: The pedestrian was crossing a driveway intersection on a sidewalk crossing, shared use path, shoulder, or edge of the travel lane.

items.title: Unknown
items.description: The actions of the pedestrian at the time of the crash cannot be determined.

items.title: There is insufficient information to determine if the vehicle was turning at the time of the crash.

6B.title: Crossing/In Roadway - Intersection
6B.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Multiple Threat
items.description: The pedestrian entered the traffic lane in front of stopped or slowing traffic and was struck by a vehicle traveling in the same direction as the stopped or slowing traffic.

items.title: Turn/Merge
items.description: The pedestrian was struck by a vehicle preparing to turn or merge, actually turning or merging, or just completing a turn or merge maneuver.

items.title: Trapped
items.description: The pedestrian was struck while crossing at a signalized intersection when the light changed and traffic started moving.

items.title: Dash
items.description: The pedestrian ran into the roadway and was struck by a vehicle whose view of the pedestrian was not obstructed.

items.title: Dart-Out
items.description: The pedestrian walked or ran into the roadway and was struck by a motorist whose view of the pedestrian was blocked until an instant before impact.

items.title: None of The Above
items.description: The crash does not conform to any of the situations described.

6B1.title: Failure To Yield - Intersection
6B1.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Pedestrian Failed to Yield
items.description: The pedestrian failed to yield to the motorist.

items.title: Motorist Failed to Yield
items.description: The motorist failed to yield to the pedestrian.

items.title: Other/Unknown
items.description: The crash does not conform to either of the actions described or it cannot be determined who failed to yield.

6B1A.title: Pedestrian Failure To Yield - Intersection
6B1A.description: Which of the following best describes the pedestrian action?

items.title: The pedestrian walked into (i.e., struck) the vehicle.
The pedestrian misjudged the gap available for crossing the roadway.
The pedestrian stepped into the travel lane and was instantaneously struck.
The crash does not conform to any of the circumstances described.

6B2.title: Turn/Merge - Intersection
6B2.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Right Turn - Parallel Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a parallel path with the pedestrian before making a right turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Right Turn - Perpendicular Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a crossing path with the pedestrian before making a right turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Left Turn - Parallel Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a parallel path with the pedestrian before making a left turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Left Turn - Perpendicular Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a crossing path with the pedestrian before making a left turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Turn/Merge - Other/Unknown
items.description: Either the approach paths or turn direction are unknown or do not fit with any of the described circumstances.

6B2A.title: Right Turn On Red - Parallel Paths
6B2A.description: Was the motorist making a right turn on red?

6B3A.title: Right Turn On Red - Perpendicular Paths
6B3A.description: Was the motorist making a right turn on red?

6C.title: Other Action - Intersection
6C.description: Which of the following circumstances apply?

items.title: Standing in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was standing in the roadway prior to the crash.

items.title: Walking in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was walking in the roadway prior to the crash.

items.title: Walking/running with traffic and was struck from behind.
Walking/running with traffic and was struck from the front.
Walking/running against traffic and was struck from behind.
Walking/running against traffic and was struck from the front.
There is insufficient information to determine either the position or direction of the pedestrian at the time of the crash.

7.title: Typical Pedestrian Action - Non-Intersection
7.description: Which of the following best describes the pedestrian action at the time of the crash?

items.title: Walking Along Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was walking along the roadway on the edge of a travel lane, on a paved or unpaved shoulder, grassy right-of-way, or sidewalk.

items.title: Waiting to Cross
items.description: The pedestrian was standing near the curb or roadway edge and waiting to cross the roadway.

items.title: Crossing an Expressway
items.description: The pedestrian was crossing a limited access expressway or expressway ramp.

items.title: Crossing the Roadway or In the Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was crossing or in a roadway that is not an expressway.

items.title: Crossing a Driveway
items.description: The pedestrian was crossing a driveway on a sidewalk crossing, shared use path, shoulder, or edge of the travel lane.

items.title: Unknown
items.description: The actions of the pedestrian at the time of the crash cannot be determined.

items.title: Walking/running with traffic and was struck from behind.
Walking/running with traffic and was struck from the front.
Walking/running against traffic and was struck from behind.
Walking/running against traffic and was struck from the front.
There is insufficient information to determine either the position or direction of the pedestrian at the time of the crash.
There is insufficient information to determine if the vehicle was turning at the time of the crash.

7C.title: Crossing/In Roadway - Non-Intersection
7C.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Multiple Threat
items.description: The pedestrian entered the traffic lane in front of stopped or slowing traffic and was struck by a vehicle traveling in the same direction as the stopped or slowing traffic.

items.title: Turn/Merge
items.description: The pedestrian was struck by a vehicle preparing to turn or merge, actually turning or merging, or just completing a turn or merge maneuver.

items.title: Trapped
items.description: The pedestrian was struck while crossing at a signalized midblock crossing when the light changed and traffic started moving.

items.title: Dash
items.description: The pedestrian ran into the roadway and was struck by a vehicle whose view of the pedestrian was not obstructed.

items.title: Dart-Out
items.description: The pedestrian walked or ran into the roadway and was struck by a motorist whose view of the pedestrian was blocked until an instant before impact.

items.title: None of The Above
items.description: The crash does not conform to any of the situations described.

7C1.title: Failure To Yield - Non-Intersection
7C1.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Pedestrian Failed to Yield
items.description: The pedestrian failed to yield to the motorist.

items.title: Motorist Failed to Yield
items.description: The motorist failed to yield to the pedestrian.

items.title: Other
items.description: The crash does not conform to either of the actions described or it cannot be determined who failed to yield.

7C1A.title: Pedestrian Failure To Yield - Non-Intersection
7C1A.description: Which of the following best describes the pedestrian action?

items.title: The pedestrian walked into (i.e., struck) the vehicle.
The pedestrian misjudged the gap available for crossing the roadway.
The pedestrian stepped into the travel lane and was instantaneously struck.
The crash does not conform to any of the circumstances described.

7C2.title: Turn/Merge - Non-Intersection
7C2.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Right Turn - Parallel Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially travelling on a parallel path with the pedestrian before making a right turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Right Turn - Perpendicular Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially travelling on a crossing path with the pedestrian before making a right turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Left Turn - Parallel Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a parallel path with the pedestrian before making a left turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Left Turn - Perpendicular Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a crossing path with the pedestrian before making a left turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Turn/Merge - Other/Unknown
items.description: Either the approach paths or motorist turn direction are unknown or do not fit with any of the described circumstances.

7D.title: Other Action - Non-Intersection
7D.description: Which of the following circumstances apply?

items.title: Standing in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was standing in the roadway prior to the crash.

items.title: Walking in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was walking in the roadway prior to the crash.

items.title: Other - Non-Intersection
items.description: The actions of the pedestrian prior to the crash cannot be determined or it cannot be determined who failed to yield.

7E.title: Crossing A Driveway Intersection
7E.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Entering a Driveway or Alley
items.description: The motor vehicle was turning into a driveway or alley and struck the pedestrian on a sidewalk/walkway or driveway crossing.

items.title: Exiting a Driveway or Alley
items.description: The motor vehicle was exiting a driveway or alley and struck the pedestrian on a sidewalk/walkway or driveway crossing.

items.title: Other/Unknown Circumstances
items.description: The pedestrian was on a driveway intersection when struck but there were other or unknown circumstances surrounding the crash from those described .

LF.title: Pedestrian Movement
LF.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 11a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approached from same direction as motorist

items.title: 11b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approached from opposite direction as motorist

items.title: 11c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 12a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approached from same direction as motorist

items.title: 12b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approached from opposite direction as motorist

items.title: 12c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

LN.title: Pedestrian Movement
LN.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 9a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 9b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 9c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 10a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 10b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 10c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

Q1.title: Motorist Direction of Travel
Q1.description: Select the motorist's initial direction of travel (before any turns).

Q3A.title: Leg of Intersection
Q3A.description: Select the leg of the intersection where the crash occurred.

Q3B.title: Leg of Intersection
Q3B.description: Select the leg of the intersection where the crash occurred.

Q3C.title: Leg of Intersection
Q3C.description: Select the leg of the intersection where the crash occurred.

RF.title: Pedestrian Movement
RF.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 7a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approached from same direction as motorist

items.title: 7b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approached from opposite direction as motorist

items.title: 7c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 8a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approached from same direction as motorist

items.title: 8b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approached from opposite direction as motorist

items.title: 8c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

RN.title: Pedestrian Movement
RN.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 5a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 5b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 5c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 6a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 6b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 6c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

SF.title: Pedestrian Movement
SF.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 3a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 3b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 3c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 4a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 4b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 4c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

SN.title: Pedestrian Movement
SN.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 1a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 1b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 1c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 2a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 2b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown
